question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/slh_dsa_sha2_128s/slh_dsa_keys.rs] [Function: PrivateKey::from_bytes_unchecked()] [Library Trust Boundary] Does the code validate that slh_keygen_internal at line 88 produces valid keys, or does it blindly trust the library output which could be malicious if the slh_dsa dependency is compromised? (High)

(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/slh_dsa_sha2_128s/slh_dsa_keys.rs] [Function: Uniform::generate()] [RNG Coupling] Is the code tightly coupled to specific RNG implementations through the RngAdapter, making it impossible to substitute different entropy sources without risking key generation compatibility issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/slh_dsa_sha2_128s/slh_dsa_keys.rs] [Struct: PrivateKey] [Type Confusion] Can PrivateKey be coerced or transmuted into other types through unsafe code elsewhere in the codebase, bypassing the type system and allowing raw manipulation of sensitive key material?
